summary: This is an email chain from November 2018 discussing a 2011 incident where a New York prosecutor argued on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein to reduce his sex offender status. The email notes that the District Attorney's office later claimed the ADA handling the case 'screwed up' and wasn't supposed to support the request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The serial sex offender who petitioned in 2011 to have his New York sex offender status reduced from level 3.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Mentioned in the signature block of the email as being from the Southern District of New York, but not directly discussed in the email body.

events.title: Epstein's Petition to Reduce Sex Offender Status
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein petitioned a New York Supreme Court judge to have his sex offender status reduced from level 3 (highest risk) in New York. A prosecutor from the New York County District Attorney's office argued on his behalf, citing that the Florida case never led to an indictment and that victims failed to cooperate. The judge denied the petition, expressing astonishment.

events.title: DANY Response on 2011 Epstein Petition
events.description: The District Attorney's office in New York (DANY) responded to inquiries about the 2011 incident, claiming the Assistant District Attorney handling the case 'screwed up' and wasn't supposed to support Epstein's request.

keyFacts: In 2011, a prosecutor from the New York County District Attorney's office argued in court on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein to reduce his sex offender status.
The judge denied Epstein's petition, expressing astonishment that a prosecutor would make such a request for a serial sex offender.
In 2018, the District Attorney's office claimed the ADA who argued for Epstein had 'screwed up' and was not supposed to support the request.
Epstein was classified as a level 3 sex offender (highest risk) in New York due to his likelihood to re-offend.
The prosecutor's argument cited that the Florida case never led to an indictment and that underage victims failed to cooperate.
